Location.title: How to get to Cascais?
Location.p1: There are several ways to travel from Lisbon Airport to Cascais: train, taxi, car rental, or booking a transfer service. Just choose the option that best suits your needs, knowing that it’s only 30 km away — about 20–30 minutes from Cascais.
Location.p2_prefix: For those traveling from Porto to Cascais, the most economical and comfortable option is called
Location.p2_suffix: . This operator offers several daily services departing from Porto (Campanhã) directly to Cascais (Alcabideche) at unbeatable prices.

Portugal.title: WHY PORTUGAL? WHY CASCAIS?
Portugal.p1: With a mild climate, over 300 days of sunshine per year, and 850 km of stunning beaches washed by the Atlantic Ocean, Portugal is the perfect place to enjoy unforgettable experiences all year round.
Portugal.p2: Recognized as one of Europe’s top tourist destinations and ranked in the Top 3 safest countries in the world, Portugal uniquely combines natural landscapes, cultural richness, and hospitality.
Portugal.p3: Just 2 hours by plane from major European capitals, Lisbon offers fast and convenient connections for visitors from around the world.
Portugal.p4: Cascais is located on the Atlantic coast, 30 km from Lisbon Airport — charming, safe, and perfect for our tournament.

Villa.title: Cascais — The Town
Villa.p1: Cascais is a charming seaside town, famous for its picturesque beaches, elegant gardens, great food, and a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Here, tradition and modernity live side by side, creating an ideal setting for leisure, sport, and well-being.
Villa.p2: With numerous noble mansions from the 17th–19th centuries, Cascais is a luxury seaside resort on Lisbon’s doorstep (just 20 minutes by car) and was once a favorite refuge of Portuguese and European royalty.
Villa.p3: With excellent tourist infrastructure and high-quality services, Cascais is the perfect stage to welcome young athletes and families from around the world.
Villa.p4: Visit Cascais and enjoy the summer.

schools.title: Accommodation in Schools
schools.p1: Accommodation and meals for the delegations will be provided in the Schools of the Municipality of Cascais, namely:

list.a: Agrupamento de Escolas de Alvide | Alcabideche
list.b: Agrupamento de Escolas da Cidadela | Cascais
list.c: Agrupamento de Escolas de Cascais | Cascais
list.d: Agrupamento de Escolas IBN Mucana | Alcabideche

schools.p2:
All matches will take place in sports halls within the municipality. Between matches and accommodation, visits to the town and its magnificent beaches are within a 15–20 minute walk. Additionally, each participant will receive a “free pass card” allowing free use of the MOBICASCAIS transport network throughout the municipality during the event. We recommend checking the official app for better use of the transport network.

Each delegation will be assigned a classroom, and all participants must bring their own sleeping bag, pillow, and mattress.

hotel.title: Accommodation in Hotels
hotel.p1: Teams wishing to stay in hotels in the region and/or requiring transportation to and from Lisbon Airport must indicate this need/preference during the online registration process and contact the Official Agents of the event in advance to ensure the best available prices. All information and contacts are available at: www.cascaisvolleycup.com

Food.title: Food & Meals
Food.p1: The canteens will only be operational from July 8th, so no meals will be provided on July 7th. On the last day of the event, July 12th, dinner will not be served.
Food.scheduleTitle: Meals will be served in the various school canteens available according to the following schedule:
Food.intolerances: In case of food intolerances, team leaders must inform the organization at the time of registration so that appropriate meals can be prepared for each case.

checkin.label: July 7 · Tuesday
checkin.text: The check-in for all teams must take place between 15:00 and 24:00 on this day at their assigned accommodation, which will be communicated in advance by the organization.

checkout.label: July 13 · Monday
checkout.text: The check-out for all teams requesting and/or requiring transfers to Lisbon Airport must be completed by 12:00 on this day.

layday.title: Lay Day
layday.text: On July 10, Friday, only the matches strictly necessary to adjust the respective schedules will be played. On this day, delegations will have the opportunity to enjoy our town, with the option of traveling to Lisbon. The train ride along the Tagus estuary is a beautiful experience, passing by all the beaches of the Estoril Coast and offering views of tourist landmarks such as the Belém Tower, Jerónimos Monastery, Monument to the Discoveries, Belém Cultural Center, MAAT, among others. All this in just a 25-minute train journey.

attention.label: Attention
attention.text: If deemed in the best interest of all participants, the organization reserves the right to change the program. In such case, all teams will be duly notified.

Hero.title: THE COMPETITION
Hero.p1: The competition format will be organized according to the number of registrations, always aiming to provide the highest possible number of matches for all teams.
Hero.p2: There will be a first phase consisting of groups of 4 teams, where all play against each other and the top-ranked teams in each group qualify. Qualified teams enter a second phase of single elimination to determine rankings from 1st to 8th place, while non-qualified teams enter a second group phase to determine the remaining rankings. Each team is guaranteed a minimum of 6 matches and a maximum of 8 matches.
Hero.p3: The formation of groups, rankings, points, and match schedules for all teams will always be updated and available in the CASCAIS VOLLEY CUP app | link available at www.cascaisvolleycup.com
